dt: {bc}of or relating to a separate person or thing {bc}{sx|individual||}
{bc}of, relating to, or being a word form denoting one person, thing, or instance
{bc}of or relating to a {a_link|single} instance or to something considered by itself

dt.t: on the way home we had a {wi}singular{/wi} adventure

dt: {bc}having the property that the matrix of coefficients of the new variables has a determinant equal to zero

pt: {sc}strange{/sc} {sc}singular{/sc} {sc}unique{/sc} {sc}peculiar{/sc} {sc}eccentric{/sc} {sc}erratic{/sc} {sc}odd{/sc} {sc}quaint{/sc} {sc}outlandish{/sc} mean departing from what is ordinary, usual, or to be expected. {sc}strange{/sc} stresses unfamiliarity and may apply to the foreign, the unnatural, the unaccountable.
{sc}unique{/sc} implies singularity and the fact of being without a known parallel.

pt.t: a career {it}unique{/it} in the annals of science
the {it}peculiar{/it} status of America's First Lady

pt: {sc}eccentric{/sc} suggests a wide divergence from the usual or normal especially in behavior.
{sc}erratic{/sc} stresses a capricious and unpredictable wandering or deviating.
{sc}odd{/sc} applies to a departure from the regular or expected.
{sc}quaint{/sc} suggests an old-fashioned but pleasant oddness.
{sc}outlandish{/sc} applies to what is uncouth, bizarre, or barbaric.

et: Middle English {it}singuler{/it}, from Anglo-French, from Latin {it}singularis{/it}, from {it}singulus{/it} only one {ma}{mat|single|}{/ma}
shortdef: of or relating to a separate person or thing : individual
of, relating to, or being a word form denoting one person, thing, or instance
of or relating to a single instance or to something considered by itself

dt: {bc}the singular number, the inflectional form denoting it, or a word in that form

shortdef: the singular number, the inflectional form denoting it, or a word in that form

dt: {bc}a form of a word that is used to refer to one person or thing
